refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GDesktopAppInfo is an implementation of GAppInfo based on desktop files.
Note that <gio/gdesktopappinfo.h> belongs to the UNIX-specific GIO interfaces, thus you have to use the gio-unix-2.0.pc pkg-config file when using it.

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_new_from_filename ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GDesktopAppInfo.

entry.para: the path of a desktop file, in the GLib filename encoding.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a new GDesktopAppInfo or NULL on error.

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_new_from_keyfile ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GDesktopAppInfo.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a new GDesktopAppInfo or NULL on error.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.18

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GDesktopAppInfo based on a desktop file id.

A desktop file id is the basename of the desktop file, including the .desktop extension. GIO is looking for a desktop file with this name in the applications subdirectories of the XDG data directories (i.e. the directories specified in the XDG_DATA_HOME and XDG_DATA_DIRS environment variables). GIO also supports the prefix-to-subdirectory mapping that is described in the Menu Spec (i.e. a desktop id of kde-foo.desktop will match /usr/share/applications/kde/foo.desktop).

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a new GDesktopAppInfo, or NULL if no desktop file with that id exists.

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_get_filename ()
refsect2.para: When info was created from a known filename, return it. In some situations such as the GDesktopAppInfo returned from g_desktop_app_info_new_from_keyfile(), this function will return NULL.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The full path to the file for info , or NULL if not known.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.24

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_get_is_hidden ()
refsect2.para: A desktop file is hidden if the Hidden key in it is set to True.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if hidden, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_get_nodisplay ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value of the NoDisplay key, which helps determine if the application info should be shown in menus. See G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_NO_DISPLAY and g_app_info_should_show().

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The value of the NoDisplay key

refsect2.para: Since: 2.30

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_get_show_in ()
refsect2.para: Checks if the application info should be shown in menus that list available applications for a specific name of the desktop, based on the OnlyShowIn and NotShowIn keys.

desktop_env should typically be given as NULL, in which case the XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP environment variable is consulted. If you want to override the default mechanism then you may specify desktop_env , but this is not recommended.
Note that g_app_info_should_show() for info will include this check (with NULL for desktop_env ) as well as additional checks.

entry.para: a string specifying a desktop name.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the info should be shown in desktop_env according to the OnlyShowIn and NotShowIn keys, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.30

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_get_generic_name ()
refsect2.para: Gets the generic name from the destkop file.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The value of the GenericName key

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_get_categories ()
refsect2.para: Gets the categories from the desktop file.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The unparsed Categories key from the desktop file; i.e. no attempt is made to split it by ';' or validate it.

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_get_keywords ()
refsect2.para: Gets the keywords from the desktop file.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The value of the Keywords key.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.32

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_get_startup_wm_class ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the StartupWMClass field from info . This represents the WM_CLASS property of the main window of the application, if launched through info .

entry.para: a GDesktopAppInfo that supports startup notify

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the startup WM class, or NULL if none is set in the desktop file.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.34

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_set_desktop_env ()

warning.para: g_desktop_app_info_set_desktop_env has been deprecated since version 2.42 and should not be used in newly-written code.
do not use this API. Since 2.42 the value of the XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP environment variable will be used.

refsect2.para: Sets the name of the desktop that the application is running in. This is used by g_app_info_should_show() and g_desktop_app_info_get_show_in() to evaluate the OnlyShowIn and NotShowIn desktop entry fields.
Should be called only once; subsequent calls are ignored.

entry.para: a string specifying what desktop this is

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_get_string ()
refsect2.para: Looks up a string value in the keyfile backing info .
The key is looked up in the "Desktop Entry" group.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a newly allocated string, or NULL if the key is not found

refsect2.para: Since: 2.36

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_get_locale_string ()
refsect2.para:
Looks up a localized string value in the keyfile backing info
translated to the current locale.
The key is looked up in the "Desktop Entry" group.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a newly allocated string, or NULL if the key is not found.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.56

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_get_boolean ()
refsect2.para: Looks up a boolean value in the keyfile backing info .
The key is looked up in the "Desktop Entry" group.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the boolean value, or FALSE if the key is not found

refsect2.para: Since: 2.36

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_has_key ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether key exists in the "Desktop Entry" group of the keyfile backing info .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the key exists

refsect2.para: Since: 2.36

refsect2.title: GDesktopAppLaunchCallback ()
refsect2.para: During invocation, g_desktop_app_info_launch_uris_as_manager() may create one or more child processes. This callback is invoked once for each, providing the process ID.

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_launch_uris_as_manager ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_desktop_app_info_launch_uris_as_manager (GDesktopAppInfo *appinfo, GList *uris, GAppLaunchContext *launch_context, GSpawnFlags spawn_flags, GSpawnChildSetupFunc user_setup, gpointer user_setup_data, GDesktopAppLaunchCallback pid_callback, gpointer pid_callback_data, GError **error);
refsect2.para: This function performs the equivalent of g_app_info_launch_uris(), but is intended primarily for operating system components that launch applications. Ordinary applications should use g_app_info_launch_uris().

If the application is launched via GSpawn, then spawn_flags , user_setup
and user_setup_data are used for the call to g_spawn_async(). Additionally, pid_callback (with pid_callback_data ) will be called to inform about the PID of the created process. See g_spawn_async_with_pipes() for information on certain parameter conditions that can enable an optimized posix_spawn() codepath to be used.
If application launching occurs via some other mechanism (eg: D-Bus activation) then spawn_flags , user_setup , user_setup_data , pid_callback and pid_callback_data are ignored.

entry.para: a GSpawnChildSetupFunc, used once for each process.
return location for a GError, or NULL

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE on successful launch, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_launch_uris_as_manager_with_fds ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_desktop_app_info_launch_uris_as_manager_with_fds (GDesktopAppInfo *appinfo, GList *uris, GAppLaunchContext *launch_context, GSpawnFlags spawn_flags, GSpawnChildSetupFunc user_setup, gpointer user_setup_data, GDesktopAppLaunchCallback pid_callback, gpointer pid_callback_data, gint stdin_fd, gint stdout_fd, gint stderr_fd, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Equivalent to g_desktop_app_info_launch_uris_as_manager() but allows you to pass in file descriptors for the stdin, stdout and stderr streams of the launched process.
If application launching occurs via some non-spawn mechanism (e.g. D-Bus activation) then stdin_fd , stdout_fd and stderr_fd are ignored.

entry.para: a GSpawnChildSetupFunc, used once for each process.
file descriptor to use for child's stdin, or -1
file descriptor to use for child's stdout, or -1
file descriptor to use for child's stderr, or -1
return location for a GError, or NULL

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE on successful launch, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.58

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_list_actions ()
refsect2.para: Returns the list of "additional application actions" supported on the desktop file, as per the desktop file specification.
As per the specification, this is the list of actions that are explicitly listed in the "Actions" key of the [Desktop Entry] group.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a list of strings, always non-NULL.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.38

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_get_action_name ()
refsect2.para: Gets the user-visible display name of the "additional application action" specified by action_name .
This corresponds to the "Name" key within the keyfile group for the action.

entry.para: the name of the action as from g_desktop_app_info_list_actions()

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the locale-specific action name.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.38

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_launch_action ()
refsect2.para: Activates the named application action.
You may only call this function on action names that were returned from g_desktop_app_info_list_actions().

Note that if the main entry of the desktop file indicates that the application supports startup notification, and launch_context is non-NULL, then startup notification will be used when activating the action (and as such, invocation of the action on the receiving side must signal the end of startup notification when it is completed). This is the expected behaviour of applications declaring additional actions, as per the desktop file specification.
As with g_app_info_launch() there is no way to detect failures that occur while using this function.

entry.para: the name of the action as from g_desktop_app_info_list_actions()

refsect2.para: Since: 2.38

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_search ()
refsect2.para: Searches desktop files for ones that match search_string .

The return value is an array of strvs. Each strv contains a list of applications that matched search_string with an equal score. The outer list is sorted by score so that the first strv contains the best-matching applications, and so on. The algorithm for determining matches is undefined and may change at any time.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a list of strvs. Free each item with g_strfreev() and free the outer list with g_free().

refsect2.title: g_desktop_app_info_get_implementations ()
refsect2.para: Gets all applications that implement interface .
An application implements an interface if that interface is listed in the Implements= line of the desktop file of the application.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a list of GDesktopAppInfo objects.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.42

refsect2.title: GDesktopAppInfo
refsect2.para: Information about an installed application from a desktop file.

refsect2.title: GDesktopAppInfoLookup

warning.para: GDesktopAppInfoLookup is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: GDesktopAppInfoLookup is an opaque data structure and can only be accessed using the following functions.

refsect2.title: struct GDesktopAppInfoLookupIface

warning.para: GDesktopAppInfoLookupIface is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Interface that is used by backends to associate default handlers with URI schemes.

refsect2.title: G_DESKTOP_APP_INFO_LOOKUP_EXTENSION_POINT_NAME

warning.para: G_DESKTOP_APP_INFO_LOOKUP_EXTENSION_POINT_NAME is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Extension point for default handler to URI association. See Extending GIO.

refsect2.title: The filename property
refsect2.para: The origin filename of this GDesktopAppInfo
Flags: Read / Write / Construct Only
Default value: NULL
